main event: American Airlines pilots and passengers spotted multiple unidentified objects near their plane over Pennsylvania and Ohio on February 24, 1959.
interesting points: The objects were described as bright, shining, saucer-shaped objects that moved rapidly and made maneuvers that were unlike any known aircraft.
The objects were spotted by the pilots, co-pilots, flight engineers, and several passengers on the flights.
The pilots reported that the objects paced their planes for extended periods of time, at times appearing to move closer to the aircraft.
Air traffic control was notified of the sightings, and the Air Force later determined the objects were likely the result of a refueling operation with B-47 bombers and KC-97 tankers in the area.
Despite the Air Force's explanation, the pilots maintained that the objects did not behave like any known aircraft and that they could not identify what they had seen.
witnesses: American Airlines pilots, co-pilots, flight engineers, and passengers
